intro: Lepturopsis triaristata, commonly known as the three-lobed sycamore, is a member of the family Bombacaceae and is native to tropical Africa. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 20 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, grey bark and large, palmate leaves with three to five lobes. The flowers are small and yellowish, arranged in panicle-like inflorescences, and the tree produces woody capsules that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests and riverine habitats.
